name: Chicken Makhani

First short marinade: 600 g chicken breast cut in thin cubes (should be thighs. I think it's okay to use breast though)
Second marinade: 0.5 tsp Kashmiri red chili powder (don't substitute it entirely with paprika, the flavor is completely different)
2 tsp ginger garlic paste (substitute with half ginger half garlic)
Sauce: 2 tbsp ghee (unholy substitute it with half oil half butter, 24 g)
8 tomatoes (or 260 g passata. Read culinary tip #2)
Green chili (1, deseeded, slit or chopped)
Raw cashews (28 of them. Roasted cashews are also fine.)
Finishing: 0.5 tbsp Kasuri methi (dried fenugreek leaves, crushed)

instructions: - Prepare the chicken in medium cubes, removing bones and extra fat.
- Add some salt to it, leave aside.
- Spread it on the chicken and leave it covered for at least 8 h.
- Leave the cashews in a bit of boiling water, to soften up.
You can either do this in a pan or in the oven. I use the oven. After pre-heating, set at 220ÂºC (convection) for 21'.
- While it's in the oven, in a (preferably high) pot, cook the tomato passata with the ghee. When it dries it will start caramelizing, which is nice to counteract its own acidity.
- Meanwhile prepare the sauce spice mix and finely blend the cashews. Add the spice when the tomato is dry.
- Keep stirring around. It will be ready when it clumps up together, not sticking to the pot.
- Take the chicken out of the oven and, in the same oven pot, combine everything: the paste, chicken and cashew cream, with about 400 mL of water.
- After simmering for some time, you should be able to see traces of fat on top. Add heavy cream and reduce for 2-3'.
- Turn off the heat and throw in the fine leaves. If you do it while hot they will turn black.

culinary: Be strict with the oven time and avoid burning the tomato/spices.
Some people add onions. But the whole point of butter chicken is having a silky smooth sauce. Onions will mess with it.
If you are not used to hot spicy food, substitute 2/3rds of the Kashmiri chili powder with sweet paprika.
